        <div class="swiper-slide" style="background-image:url(https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/shutterstock_598851473.jpg); height:550px;">
         <div class="caption-container">
          <div class="inner">
           <div class="caption cm-animate-up">
            <p>
             AquaH, the International Master of Science in Health Management in Aquaculture, is a programme that focuses on developing innovative and sustainable solutions within the field of health management of farmed aquatic animals
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="swiper-slide" style="background-image:url(https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/48054219056_a378bb5dc3_o.1.jpg); height:550px;">
         <div class="caption-container">
          <div class="inner">
           <div class="caption cm-animate-up">
            <p>
             Part of the prestigious
             <a href="https://www.eacea.ec.europa.eu/scholarships/erasmus-mundus-catalogue_en" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
              ERASMUS Mundus Master programmes
             </a>
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="swiper-slide" style="background-image:url(https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/02/healthy-penaeids.jpg); height:550px;">
         <div class="caption-container">
          <div class="inner">
           <div class="caption cm-animate-up">
            <p>
             Bringing together a consortium of 4 leading European centres of excellence in the field of aquaculture
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="swiper-slide" style="background-image:url(https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/48054298607_8dcb589aef_k.1.jpg); height:550px;">
         <div class="caption-container">
          <div class="inner">
           <div class="caption cm-animate-up">
            <p>
             <span style="font-weight: 400;">
              Training experts in aquaculture health,  sustainability pioneers, entrepreneurs and innovators of the future
             </span>
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="button-prev">
       </div>
       <div class="button-next">
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="slider-border">
     </section>
     <section class="pod two-column content light-blue" style="padding-top:80px; padding-bottom:40px; ">
      <div class="container">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-6 left">
         <p>
          <img alt="" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-181" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="393" sizes="(max-width: 537px) 100vw, 537px" src="https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/consortium-of-academia-1.png" srcset="https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/consortium-of-academia-1.png 537w, https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/consortium-of-academia-1-300x220.png 300w" width="537"/>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="col-md-6 right">
         <h2>
          Bringing together an expert consortium of academia and industry
         </h2>
         <p>
          The AquaH programme combines 4 of Europe’s leading institutes in aquaculture with industry expertise to provide students with an opportunity to become entrepreneurial pioneers and address the challenges of increased global demand on fish stocks.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://aquah.eu/about/">
           <span class="button-link hvr-ripple-out">
            Find out more
           </span>
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="pod two-column content white" style="padding-top:80px; padding-bottom:50px; ">
      <div class="container">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-6 left">
         <h2>
          Explore the programme
         </h2>
         <p>
          The programme consists of three principal studies and training within the field of aquaculture:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Comprehensive training in all health aspects in the farming of aquatic animals
          </li>
          <li>
           In-depth theoretical and hands-on training in the latest techniques of aquaculture health and disease management
          </li>
          <li>
           Training in problem-solving and development of innovative solutions for the sustainable development of the aquaculture industry
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
          <a href="https://aquah.eu/programme/">
           <span class="button-link hvr-ripple-out">
            Explore
           </span>
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="col-md-6 right">
         <p>
          <img alt="" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-177" decoding="async" height="347" sizes="(max-width: 539px) 100vw, 539px" src="https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/explore.png" srcset="https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/explore.png 539w, https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/explore-300x193.png 300w" width="539"/>
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="pod content parallax-window white" data-image-src="https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/apply-now-1.jpg" data-parallax="scroll" style="min-height:400px; padding-top:150px; padding-bottom:150px;">
      <div class="container">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-12">
         <h3 style="text-align: center;">
          Become an aquaculture health management innovator
          <br/>
          and answer the challenges of global food demand and overfishing
         </h3>
         <p style="text-align: center;">
          <a href="https://aquah.eu/apply/">
           <span class="button-link hvr-ripple-out">
            APPLY NOW
           </span>
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>

     <section class="pod content white" style="padding-top:80px; padding-bottom:px; ">
      <div class="container">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-12">
         <h1>
          Objectives of the programme
         </h1>
         <p>
          The aquaculture sector has seen a massive increase in production over the past 35 years thanks to major technological and biotechnological advances. The ever-continuing intensification in aquaculture systems, along with an increased production scale has, however, inevitably resulted in the increased occurrence of disease outbreaks. This has created a high
          <strong>
           need for aquaculture health management experts
          </strong>
          that can respond to the growing demand for solution to health challenges in the aquaculture industry and contribute to a growing, innovative sector that is key to the world’s food needs.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="pod content white" style="padding-top:40px; padding-bottom:20px; ">
      <div class="container">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-12">
         <h1>
          Structure of the course
         </h1>
         <p>
          The programme consists of an initial common semester that is carried out at
          <a href="https://aquah.eu/partner/ghent-university/">
           Ghent University
          </a>
          , then in the 2nd and 3rd semester students can choose* between 3 learning paths that will deepen their knowledge on a specific aspect of the overarching programme theme.
         </p>
         <p>
          <img alt="Learning path" class="aligncenter size-large wp-image-841" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="485" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/programme-scheme-1024x485.png" srcset="https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/programme-scheme-1024x485.png 1024w, https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/programme-scheme-300x142.png 300w, https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/programme-scheme-768x364.png 768w, https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/programme-scheme-1536x728.png 1536w, https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/programme-scheme-2048x971.png 2048w" width="1024"/>
         </p>
         <p>
          Curriculum and course details: check the
          <a href="https://studiekiezer.ugent.be/international-master-of-science-in-health-management-in-aquaculture-en/programma/current" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
           study guides
          </a>
         </p>
         <h6>
          * chosen learning paths may have to be redistributed to maintain balance among the learning paths per student cohort
         </h6>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>

          <img alt="" class="alignnone wp-image-644 size-full" decoding="async" height="304" src="https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/Logo-UAB-UB.gif" width="458"/>

     <section class="pod content white" style="padding-top:100px; padding-bottom:80px; ">
      <div class="container">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-12">
         <p>
          <strong>
           In the 2nd or 3rd semester
          </strong>
          , students will undertake an internship with a company or research institute among our extended international network of partners and contacts. The internship is a practically oriented scientific project where they will gain the skills and knowledge that will prepare them for the labour market.
         </p>
         <p>
          Finally, in the 4th semester a master dissertation or thesis is undertaken that will combine a students acquired skill and knowledge.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>

         <h2>
          <span style="font-weight: 400;">
           Semester 2 & 3 : choose between 3 learning paths
          </span>
         </h2>
         <div class="semesters-container">
          <ul class="semesters-tabs">
           <li class="active" data-id="308">
            Semester 2 & 3 – NTNU
           </li>
           <li class="" data-id="315">
            Semester 2 & 3 – WU

          <div class="semesters">
           <div class="row semester active" data-id="308">
            <div class="col-md-6">
             <div class="semester-content">
              <h4>
               Semester 2 & 3 – NTNU
              </h4>
              <p>
               <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                Ecosystems and Health at
               </span>
               <b>
                The Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU)
               </b>
               <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                , Norway.
               </span>
              </p>
              <p>
               <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                The path focuses on the importance of the interactions between farmed and native organisms, including how diseases and parasites are spread (salmon lice); interactions between native microbial communities and farmed hosts; the influence of water quality (e.g. toxic algae) on the health and welfare of farmed fish. The overall focus is normally on how the environment, or the ecosystem, may affect fish health, not on the effects of farming on the environment. Learning activities mainly include health, welfare and environmental issues for fish from larval to adult stages. NTNU currently has major involvements in research on health issues in marine fish farming and has a strong relationship with industry.
               </span>
              </p>

              </h4>
              <p>
               <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                Disease Prevention Management & Health at
               </span>
               <b>
                Wageningen University (WU)
               </b>
               <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                , Netherlands.
               </span>
              </p>
              <p>
               <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                The path focuses on relevant innovations by studying fish and shellfish nutrition and health. This is mainly in circular aquaculture systems, be it in recirculating aquaculture systems or ponds. Research looks into how nutrition influences health and how novel feeds improve disease resistance; it also considers the latest strategies in terms of activation of the immune system and key therapeutic tools, such as new generation vaccines.

           <div class="row semester" data-id="317">
            <div class="col-md-6">
             <div class="semester-content">
              <h4>
               Semester 2 & 3 – UAB / UB
              </h4>
              <p>
               <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                Physiology and Health at
               </span>
               <b>
                Universitat Autònoma de Barcelona and Universitat de Barcelona (
               </b>
               <b>
                UAB/UB)
               </b>
               <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                , Spain.
               </span>
              </p>
              <p>
               <span style="font-weight: 400;">
                The path focuses on giving students the opportunity to acquire knowledge on the physiological mechanisms involved in the overall health of fish and shellfish. Within this, the following aspects will be considered: harmonious growth and balanced nutrition; the generation of the stress response and stress prevention methodologies; the innate and adaptive mechanisms of immune defences; the regulatory systems involved; knowledge of infections; pathological signs; and the patho-physiological response.
               </span>
              </p>

      <div class="container">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-12">
         <h1 style="text-align: center;">
          University Partners
         </h1>
         <p style="text-align: center;">
          In order to respond to the need for expert training in aquaculture health management, the AquaH consortium combines the expertise of 4 European centres of excellence in the field of aquaculture
         </p>
         <p style="text-align: center;">
          <div class="row partners full">
           <div class="col-md-6">
            <div class="partner">
             <div class="logo" style="background-image:url(https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/ghent.png);">
              <a href="https://aquah.eu/partner/ghent-university/">
              </a>
             </div>
             <div class="clear">
             </div>
             <p>
              <strong>
               Ghent University
              </strong>
             </p>
             <div class="description">
              Ghent University is one of the major universities in Belgium with over 44,000 students and is ranked among the top-100 universities worldwide. The university provides students with high-quality academic teaching, excellent infrastructure and a wide scope of facilities.
             </div>
             <a href="https://aquah.eu/partner/ghent-university/">
              <span class="button-link hvr-ripple-out">
               Find out more
              </span>
             </a>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="col-md-6">
            <div class="partner">
             <div class="logo" style="background-image:url(https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/ntnu.png);">
              <a href="https://aquah.eu/partner/the-norwegian-university-of-science-and-technology/">
              </a>
             </div>
             <div class="clear">
             </div>
             <p>
              <strong>
               The Norwegian University of Science and Technology
              </strong>
             </p>
             <div class="description">
              NTNU has a main profile in science and technology, a variety of programmes of professional study, and great academic breadth that also includes the humanities, social sciences, economics, medicine, health sciences, educational science, architecture, entrepreneurship, art disciplines and artistic activities.
             </div>
             <a href="https://aquah.eu/partner/the-norwegian-university-of-science-and-technology/">
              <span class="button-link hvr-ripple-out">
               Find out more
              </span>
             </a>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="col-md-6">
            <div class="partner">
             <div class="logo" style="background-image:url(https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/wu.png);">
              <a href="https://aquah.eu/partner/wageningen-university/">
              </a>
             </div>
             <div class="clear">
             </div>
             <p>
              <strong>
               Wageningen University
              </strong>
             </p>
             <div class="description">
              The strength of Wageningen University & Research lies in its ability to join the forces of specialised research institutes and the university. It also lies in the combined efforts of the various fields of natural and social sciences. This union of expertise leads to scientific breakthroughs that can quickly be put into practice and be incorporated into education.
             </div>
             <a href="https://aquah.eu/partner/wageningen-university/">
              <span class="button-link hvr-ripple-out">
               Find out more
              </span>
             </a>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="col-md-6">
            <div class="partner">
             <div class="logo" style="background-image:url(https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/uab-e1610987648143.png);">
              <a href="https://aquah.eu/partner/universitat-autonoma-de-barcelona-and-universitat-de-barcelona/">
              </a>
             </div>
             <div class="clear">
             </div>
             <p>
              <strong>
               Universitat Autònoma de Barcelona and Universitat de Barcelona
              </strong>
             </p>
             <div class="description">
              UAB is a leading university providing quality teaching in a wide variety of courses that meet the needs of society and are adapted to the new models of the Europe of Knowledge. Our courses provide students with outstanding practical experience helping them to be better prepared as they enter the professional world.
             </div>
             <a href="https://aquah.eu/partner/universitat-autonoma-de-barcelona-and-universitat-de-barcelona/">
              <span class="button-link hvr-ripple-out">
               Find out more
              </span>
             </a>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>

     <section class="pod content white" style="padding-top:80px; padding-bottom:20px; ">
      <div class="container">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-12">
         <h1>
          Testimonies
         </h1>
         <div class="testimonials">
          <h3 class="name">
           Joyce Hilario, The Philippines, graduated in 2023
          </h3>
          <div class="text">
           <div class="simple-block-content">
            <p>
             <a href="https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/joyce.png">
              <img alt="" class="alignleft wp-image-794 size-thumbnail" decoding="async" height="150" sizes="(max-width: 150px) 100vw, 150px" src="https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/joyce-150x150.png" srcset="https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/joyce-150x150.png 150w, https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/joyce-300x300.png 300w, https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/joyce-1024x1024.png 1024w, https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/joyce-768x768.png 768w, https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/joyce.png 1518w" width="150"/>
             </a>
             <em>
              “AquaH allowed me to ascend to a new level in my professional career and broaden my knowledge in the field of aquatic animal health. Being able to access education from the various consortium universities, which provide a cutting-edge research environment and world-class quality education, has undoubtedly made it an experience of a lifetime. Not only did we gain a stronger intellectual foundation and enhance our research skills to address aquaculture and food security problems, but we also made friends, explored new places, and experienced different cultures! Forever grateful to AquaH and Erasmus Mundus!”
             </em>
            </p>
            <blockquote>
             <p>
              <span style="color: #0033cc;">
               Joyce resumed her position as a Senior Researcher at the National Fisheries Research and Development Institute in the Philippines.
              </span>
             </p>
            </blockquote>
           </div>
          </div>
          <h3 class="rating">
           Juan Bosco Ara Díaz, Spain, graduated in 2023
          </h3>
         </div>
         <div class="testimonials">
          <div class="text">
           <div class="simple-block-content">
            <p>
             <a href="https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/bosco.png">
              <img alt="" class="alignleft wp-image-789 size-thumbnail" decoding="async" height="150" src="https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/bosco-150x150.png" width="150"/>
             </a>
             <em>
              “The International Master of Science in Health Management in Aquaculture (AQUAH) provided me with a fantastic opportunity to learn about innovative solutions in the application of new technologies to aquaculture health management. It also encouraged me to develop critical thinking skills in the field, so that I am prepared to meet the future challenges of this industry. The program allowed me to network and exchange ideas with innovators from different European countries, such as Belgium, the Netherlands, Denmark and Norway. I highly recommend this program to anyone who is interested in a career in aquaculture health management. I would also encourage students to be proactive during the program and take full advantage of all the opportunities that it offers.”
             </em>
            </p>
            <blockquote>
             <p>
              <span style="color: #0033cc;">
               Bosco is currently working for
               <a href="https://www.bernaqua.com/" rel="noopener" style="color: #0033cc;" target="_blank">
                BernAqua NV
               </a>
               as Quality and Product Registration Officer since end of 2023.
              </span>
             </p>
            </blockquote>
           </div>
          </div>
          <h3 class="rating">
           Paola Galluzzi Polesi, Brazil, graduated in 2023
          </h3>
         </div>
         <div class="testimonials">
          <div class="text">
           <div class="simple-block-content">
            <p>
             <a href="https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/paola.png">
              <img alt="" class="alignleft wp-image-792 size-thumbnail" decoding="async" height="150" sizes="(max-width: 150px) 100vw, 150px" src="https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/paola-150x150.png" srcset="https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/paola-150x150.png 150w, https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/paola-300x300.png 300w, https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/paola.png 708w" width="150"/>
             </a>
             <em>
              “Being part of the Erasmus Mundus Health Management in Aquaculture (AquaH) was a life changing opportunity. The courses provided by Ghent University were essential for creating a good and strong basic knowledge on health in aquaculture and, later, the chance to continue my studies at NTNU (Norway) was fantastic. In Norway, we are in close proximity to many aquaculture companies and the internship, during the second semester of the course, was essential for me to build the connections that allowed me to start a career in the industry right after graduating. I believe that this programme is a must if you wish to pursue a career in health in aquaculture”
             </em>
            </p>
            <blockquote>
             <p>
              <span style="color: #0033cc;">
               Paola started an industrial PhD at the R&D department of
               <a href="https://www.biomar.com/" rel="noopener" style="color: #0033cc;" target="_blank">
                Biomar
               </a>
               in the fall of 2024
              </span>
             </p>
            </blockquote>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>

        <div class="col-md-12">
         <h1>
          Participation costs (tuition fees)
         </h1>
         <table border="1" cellpadding="5">
          <tbody>
           <tr>
            <td>
            </td>
            <td style="text-align: center;">
             EEA* Students
            </td>
            <td style="text-align: center;">
             non-EEA student
            </td>
           </tr>
           <tr>
            <td style="text-align: right;">
             <span style="color: #808080;">
              Erasmus Mundus grant holders**
             </span>
            </td>
            <td style="text-align: center;">
             <span style="color: #808080;">
              4500 EUR/y
             </span>
            </td>
            <td>
             <span style="color: #808080;">
              9000 EUR/y
             </span>
            </td>
           </tr>
           <tr>
            <td style="text-align: right;">
             Self-funding participants
            </td>
            <td style="text-align: center;">
             4500 EUR/y
            </td>
            <td style="text-align: left;">
             Year 1: 9000 EUR
             <br/>
             Year 2:  9000 EUR (for
             <a href="https://aquah.eu/programme/">
              NTNU and UAB track
             </a>
             )
             <br/>
             18.000 EUR (for
             <a href="https://aquah.eu/programme/">
              WU track
             </a>
             )
            </td>
           </tr>
          </tbody>
         </table>
         <p>
          *  Programme countries (EEA) are: EU + Republic of North Macedonia, Iceland, Norway, Liechtenstein, Turkey and Serbia.
          <br/>
          Partner countries (non-EEA): all others.
          <br/>
          For a detailed list of which countries are partner countries for the Erasmus+, please visit the
          <a href="https://erasmus-plus.ec.europa.eu/programme-guide/part-a/eligible-countries?" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
           Erasmus Mundus programme website
          </a>
          .
         </p>
         <p>
          ** IMPORTANT NOTE: for academic year 2025-26, no Erasmus Mundus Scholarships are available
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="pod content dark-blue" style="padding-top:80px; padding-bottom:80px; ">
      <div class="container">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-12">
         <h2>
          <span style="font-weight: 400;">
           Estimated living & accommodation expenses
          </span>
         </h2>
         <p>
          You can assess the cost of living in Ghent or our other European partner institutes on the
          <a href="https://www.numbeo.com/cost-of-living/in/Gent" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
           Numbeo website
          </a>
          .
          <br/>
          Please note: the figures provided tend to overestimate a student’s true living costs. Our estimates are the following:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           in Ghent, Belgium: estimated 850€/month (check detailed information
           <a href="https://www.ugent.be/en/facilities" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
            here
           </a>
           )
          </li>
          <li>
           In Trondheim, Norway: tbc
          </li>
          <li>
           In Wageningen, Netherlands: estimated 950 €/month (check detailed information
           <a href="https://www.wur.nl/en/Education-Programmes/master/Study-expenses.htm" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
            here
           </a>
           )
          </li>
          <li>
           In Barcelona, Spain: estimated 850-950€/month (check detailed information
           <a href="https://www.uab.cat/web/mobility-international-exchange/international-support-service/living-in-barcelona/budget-for-living-in-barcelona-1345819416582.html" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
            here
           </a>
           )
          </li>
         </ul>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="pod content light-blue" style="padding-top:80px; padding-bottom:80px; ">
      <div class="container">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-12">
         <h2>
          Scholarships
         </h2>
         <p>
          The programme features a limited number of
          <a href="https://erasmus-plus.ec.europa.eu/opportunities/individuals/students/erasmus-mundus-joint-masters-scholarships" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
           Erasmus Mundus Scholarships
          </a>
          . These scholarships cover the tuition fee + a 1000€ monthly allowance + up to 7000€ contribution to be used for travel and installation costs (
          <a href="https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/grant-scheme.png" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
           click here for details on the grant structure
          </a>
          ). For other questions regarding the EMJM scholarships, check the
          <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/portal/screen/support/faq;type=0,1;categories=;tenders=;programme=null;keyword=EMJMD;freeTextSearchKeyword=;matchWholeText=true;period=null;status=0,1;sortQuery=relevance;faqListKey=faqSearchTablePageState">
           FAQ’s page
          </a>
          .
         </p>
         <p>
          Application for the scholarship is integrated in the
          <a href="https://aquah.eu/apply/">
           online application process
          </a>
          .
         </p>
         <p>
          For other scholarship opportunities, please check these popular scholarship portals:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           <a href="http://www.scholarshipportal.com/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
            Scholarship Portal
           </a>
          </li>
          <li>
           <a href="http://scholarship-positions.com/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
            Scholarship Positions
           </a>
          </li>
          <li>
           <a href="http://www.scholars4dev.com/8647/europe-scholarships-international-students/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
            Scholarships for Development
           </a>
          </li>
          <li>
           <a href="https://www.topuniversities.com/student-info/scholarship-advice/scholarships-study-europe" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
            Top Universities – Scholarships to Study in Europe
           </a>
          </li>
          <li>
           <a href="http://www.scholarshipstimes.com/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
            Scholarship Times
           </a>
          </li>
         </ul>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="pod content parallax-window white" data-image-src="https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/apply-now-1.jpg" data-parallax="scroll" style="min-height:400px; padding-top:150px; padding-bottom:100px;">
      <div class="container">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-12">
         <h3 style="text-align: center;">
          Become an aquaculture health management innovator
          <br/>
          and answer the challenges of global food demand and overfishing
         </h3>
         <p style="text-align: center;">
          <a href="https://aquah.eu/apply/">
           <span class="button-link hvr-ripple-out">
            APPLY NOW
           </span>
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>

     <section class="page-header" style="background-image:url('https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/new1.jpg')">
     </section>
     <!-- <section class="page-header-border"></section> -->
     <section class="pod content white" style="padding-top:80px; padding-bottom:20px; ">
      <div class="container">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-12">
         <p>
          Application for academic year 2025-26 opens October 2024! Follow the steps below for a successful application:
         </p>
         <ol>
          <li>
           Carefully read the academic admission requirements …
          </li>
          <li>
           … and the language requirements of the programme.
          </li>
          <li>
           Ensure you have all of the information and documents needed to complete your online application.
          </li>
          <li>
           Complete the online application.
          </li>
         </ol>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="pod content white" style="padding-top:20px; padding-bottom:40px; ">
      <div class="container">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-12">
         <div class="accordion">
          <div class="item">
           <div class="title">
            <span>
             1
            </span>
            Academic Requirements
           </div>
           <div class="description">
            <div class="inner">
             <p>
              <strong>
               Candidates must:
              </strong>
             </p>
             <ul>
              <li>
               Hold a Bachelor’s degree of min 180ECTS (equivalent to 3 years) from a university or recognised equivalent institute.
              </li>
              <li>
               A Grade Point Average (GPA) for this BSc of at least 70% of the maximum grade
              </li>
              <li>
               Demonstrate through their transcripts of records to have successfully acquired basic science training in at least 5 out of 7 of the following fields:
               <br/>
               (i) Mathematics
               <br/>
               (ii) Physics
               <br/>
               (iii) Chemistry
               <br/>
               (iv) Biochemistry
               <br/>
               (v) Biology
               <br/>
               (vi) Microbiology
               <br/>
               (vii) Engineering
              </li>
              <li>
               Statistics qualifications at level 1 and 2*
              </li>
              <li>
               Some academic or professional background in aquaculture is recommended
              </li>
             </ul>
             <p>
              (*) see
              <a href="https://ssc.wur.nl/Handbook/2019/Course/MAT-15403" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
               Wageningen University study guide
              </a>
              for details
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="item">
           <div class="title">
            <span>
             2
            </span>
            Language Requirements
           </div>
           <div class="description">
            <div class="inner">
             <p>
              The applicant must be proficient in English. English language proficiency can be met by providing a certificate (not older than 2 years) of one of the following tests:
             </p>
             <ul>
              <li>
               TOEFL IBT 92, with subscore for speaking 23
              </li>
              <li>
               ACADEMIC IELTS 6,5 overall score, with a min. of 6 for writing and 6 for speaking
              </li>
              <li>
               CAMBRIDGE English CAE (Advanced) score between 176-210 or Grade C
              </li>
              <li>
               Cambridge FCE/B2 Certificate, score between 176-190 or Grade A
              </li>
             </ul>
             <p>
              note! TOEFL/IELTS predictive tests and TOEIC will not be accepted
             </p>
             <p>
              <strong>
               <span style="color: #ff0000;">
                Language of instruction is not accepted
               </span>
               , except for:
              </strong>
             </p>
             <ul>
              <li>
               applicants who are nationals from or have obtained a bachelor and/or master degree in a higher education institute with English as the mode of instruction in the USA, Australia, New Zealand, United Kingdom, Republic of Ireland or Canada (when graduating from a Canadian institute a student must have a certificate that the mode of instruction was English).
              </li>
             </ul>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="item">
           <div class="title">
            <span>
             3
            </span>
            Documents to upload during application
           </div>
           <div class="description">
            <div class="inner">
             <p>
              Along the online application you will be asked to upload:
             </p>
             <ul>
              <li>
               pdf of your passport
              </li>
              <li>
               short CV (max 2 pages)
              </li>
              <li>
               bachelor diploma (or certificate of enrolment if you are still in your last year)
              </li>
              <li>
               transcript of records
              </li>
              <li>
               English language certificate (only certificates listed above are accepted!)
              </li>
              <li>
               motivation letter (max 1 page)
              </li>
              <li>
               reference letters are not required. You can provide it voluntarily but it will not be taken into account in the evaluation score
              </li>
             </ul>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="pod content light-blue" style="padding-top:50px; padding-bottom:25px; ">
      <div class="container">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-12">
         <h2>
          4
          <a href="https://oasis.ugent.be/oasis-web/registratie?target=inschrijven&arCode=IMAQHE&aj=2024">
           Start your online application
          </a>
         </h2>
         <p>
          We recommend checking the
          <a href="https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/AquaH-OASIS-application-manual.pdf" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
           Manual of the online application tool
          </a>
          (pdf, 2.4MB).
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="pod content white" style="padding-top:50px; padding-bottom:50px; ">
      <div class="container">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-12">
         <h3>
          Application deadlines
         </h3>
         <p>
          <img alt="" class="aligncenter wp-image-830 size-large" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="258" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" src="https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/application-deadlines-2-1024x258.png" srcset="https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/application-deadlines-2-1024x258.png 1024w, https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/application-deadlines-2-300x76.png 300w, https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/application-deadlines-2-768x194.png 768w, https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/application-deadlines-2-1536x388.png 1536w, https://aquah.eu/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/application-deadlines-2-2048x517.png 2048w" width="1024"/>
         </p>
         <h5>
          Please note, no scholarships are available for 2025-26
         </h5>
         <h3>
          I submitted my application, what happens now?
         </h3>
         <p>
          Once you submitted your application file, your academic suitability will be assessed. If you fit the academic requirements you will receive a Letter of Admission (LoA), after which you will be invited to send scanned versions of the legalised copies of your Bachelors degree, Transcripts of Academic Records. You will be informed via email throughout the application process on how to proceed.
         </p>
         <h3>
          Apply for your visa
         </h3>
         <p>
          If you need a visa to enter Belgium, you should start your visa application as soon as you have received your Letter of Admission.
         </p>
         <p>
          The AquaH programme includes student mobility to other
          <a href="https://home-affairs.ec.europa.eu/policies/schengen-borders-and-visa/schengen-area_en" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
           Schengen countries
          </a>
          , therefor you need to apply for a long stay student visa type D with
          <strong>
           code B35
          </strong>
          . With this visa, after your arrival in Belgium, you will be able to apply for a 2 year residence permit that will allow you to travel to other Schengen countries without having to apply for a visa in these countries.
         </p>
         <p>
          When applying for a visa, you will be asked to
          <strong>
           prove your
           <a href="https://www.ugent.be/prospect/en/administration/visa-residence-permit/subsistence.htm" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
            solvency
           </a>
          </strong>
          (i.e. creditworthiness). This solvency can be proved in different ways:
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           A scholarship award letter (document certifying that you have been granted a scholarship)
          </li>
          <li>
           An affidavit of support (or a financial guarantee)
          </li>
          <li>
           A blocked account and solvency letter: Ghent University can provide a letter to prove sufficient means of subsistence provided you have transferred the required financial means to a bank account of Ghent University, where they will be blocked on a personal account. The financial means will then be reimbursed to you on a monthly basis. For more information, contact
           <a href="mailto:solvencybama@ugent.be">
            solvencybama@ugent.be
           </a>
          </li>
         </ul>
         <h3>
          Questions related to the application procedure
         </h3>
         <ul>
          <li>
           For all questions in relation to the application procedure and other questions regarding tuition fees, accommodation, visa matters, etc. please contact
           <a href="mailto:applications.itc@ugent.be">
            applications.itc@ugent.be
           </a>
           .
          </li>
          <li>
           More information about the legalisation procedure
           <a href="https://www.ugent.be/prospect/en/administration/application/application-degree/legalisation.htm" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
            can be found here
           </a>
           .
          </li>
         </ul>
         <h3>
          Other questions
         </h3>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Check our
           <a href="https://aquah.eu/faqs/">
            FAQ’s pages
           </a>
          </li>
         </ul>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>

         </h1>
         <p>
          The AquaH programme was created in 2019 by a consortium partnership between 4 leading European academic institutes that wanted to answer the challenge of educating and training the next generation of health managers within the field of aquaculture. Identifying a real shortfall of health management both in research and the private sector, the programme developers realised there was a large need to provide innovative expertise to the field to answer the growing challenge of global food demands and overfishing.
         </p>
         <p>
          The final programme structure was awarded the prestigious Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (EMJMD) due to the consortium’s strong internationalisation and corresponding student and staff mobility.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="pod content white" style="padding-top:0px; padding-bottom:40px; ">
      <div class="container">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-12">
         <h2 class="erasmus">
          Erasmus Mundus
         </h2>
         <p>
          An Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree (EMJMD) is a prestigious, integrated study programme, jointly delivered by an international consortium of higher education institutions (HEIs) and, where relevant, other partners with specific expertise and interest in the studies covered.
         </p>
         <p>
         </p>
         <p>
          <strong>
           EMJMDs aim to:
          </strong>
         </p>
         <ul>
          <li>
           Foster excellence, innovation, and internationalisation in HEIs
          </li>
          <li>
           Boost the attractiveness of the European Higher Education Area (EHEA) and support the EU’s external action in the field of higher education
          </li>
          <li>
           Improve the level of competencies and skills of Master graduates and their employability
          </li>
         </ul>
         <p>
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="pod content dark-blue" style="padding-top:50px; padding-bottom:35px; ">
      <div class="container">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-12">
         <h4 style="text-align: center;">
          The AquaH programme was awarded the Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree in
          <br/>
          Health Management in Aquaculture status due to the combination of the excellence
          <br/>
          and expertise of the five leading European institutions that make up the programme:
         </h4>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>
     <section class="pod content white" style="padding-top:80px; padding-bottom:80px; ">
      <div class="container">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-12">
         <p style="text-align: center;">
          <div class="row pillars">
           <div class="col-md-3 col-xs-6">
            <div class="pillar">
             <div class="icon">
              <a href="https://aquah.eu/partner/ghent-university/">
              </a>
             </div>
             <div class="clear">
             </div>
             <a href="https://aquah.eu/partner/ghent-university/">
              Ghent University
             </a>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="col-md-3 col-xs-6">
            <div class="pillar">
             <div class="icon">
              <a href="https://aquah.eu/partner/the-norwegian-university-of-science-and-technology/">
              </a>
             </div>
             <div class="clear">
             </div>
             <a href="https://aquah.eu/partner/the-norwegian-university-of-science-and-technology/">
              The Norwegian University of Science and Technology
             </a>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="col-md-3 col-xs-6">
            <div class="pillar">
             <div class="icon">
              <a href="https://aquah.eu/partner/wageningen-university/">
              </a>
             </div>
             <div class="clear">
             </div>
             <a href="https://aquah.eu/partner/wageningen-university/">
              Wageningen University
             </a>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="col-md-3 col-xs-6">
            <div class="pillar">
             <div class="icon">
              <a href="https://aquah.eu/partner/universitat-autonoma-de-barcelona-and-universitat-de-barcelona/">
              </a>
             </div>
             <div class="clear">
             </div>
             <a href="https://aquah.eu/partner/universitat-autonoma-de-barcelona-and-universitat-de-barcelona/">
              Universitat Autònoma de Barcelona and Universitat de Barcelona
             </a>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </p>
         <p style="text-align: center;">
          Each partner’s long standing expertise and strong reputation in aquaculture research created the ideal programme to advance the field of Aquaculture Health Management, which accordingly afforded the programme the prestigious Erasmus Mundus award. As part of the award, students who wish to study on the programme can apply for the
          <a href="https://eacea.ec.europa.eu/erasmus-plus/library/scholarships-catalogue_en" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
           Erasmus Mundus scholarship
          </a>
          .
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </section>

      <div class="container">

        <div class="col-md-12">
         <h3 style="text-align: center;">
          Become an aquaculture health management innovator
          <br/>
          and answer the challenges of global food demand and overfishing
         </h3>
         <p style="text-align: center;">
          <a href="https://aquah.eu/apply/">

            APPLY NOW

     <section class="pod content white" style="padding-top:80px; padding-bottom:80px; ">
      <div class="container">
       <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-12">
         <h1>
          Frequently Asked Questions
         </h1>
         <p>
          Please find below a series of the most frequently asked questions by students enquiring about studying on the AquaH programme. Please
          <a href="https://aquah.eu/contact/">
           contact
          </a>
          our team for any other enquiries that are not covered here.
         </p>
         <div class="row faqs">
          <div class="col-md-6">
           <div class="faq">
            <div class="question">
             Where will I live?
            </div>
            <div class="answer">
             <div class="inner">
              All programme partners provide adequate student housing on or in the vicinity of their campus.
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="col-md-6">
           <div class="faq">
            <div class="question">
             Can I work during my studies?
            </div>
            <div class="answer">
             <div class="inner">
              The AquaH programme is highly intensive, therefore it is unlikely that you will be able to comfortably work at a regular job during your time of study. If you would like more information on the expected living costs of studying on the programme, please visit our
              <a href="https://aquah.eu/fees-costs-scholarships/">
               Fees/Costs and Scholarships Page
              </a>
              .
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="col-md-6">
           <div class="faq">
            <div class="question">
             What is the duration of the masters programme?
            </div>
            <div class="answer">
             <div class="inner">
              The programme starts in mid-September and runs for 2 years, to be completed in early July or early September in the case of exam resits.
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="col-md-6">
           <div class="faq">
            <div class="question">
             How much money do I need for living expenses?
            </div>
            <div class="answer">
             <div class="inner">
              Living costs can vary dependent on the learning path you choose. Please see our section on estimated living & accommodation expenses on our
              <a href="https://aquah.eu/fees-costs-scholarships/">
               Fees/Costs & Scholarships Page
              </a>
              to find out more.
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="col-md-6">
           <div class="faq">
            <div class="question">
             What can I do on completion of my studies?
            </div>
            <div class="answer">
             <div class="inner">
              There are a range of career opportunites from studying on the AquaH programme. Please see our
              <a href="https://aquah.eu/careers/">
               Careers Page
              </a>
              for more information.
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="col-md-6">
           <div class="faq">
            <div class="question">
             Do I need a visa?
            </div>
            <div class="answer">
             <div class="inner">
              Non-EU citizens will need a student visa. Please see further details here:
              <a href="https://www.ugent.be/prospect/en/administration/visa-residencepermit-insurance/visa">
               Visa's for Belgium — Info for prospective students (ugent.be)
              </a>
              .
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="col-md-6">
           <div class="faq">
            <div class="question">
             What are the academic entry requirements?
            </div>
            <div class="answer">
             <div class="inner">
              Entry requirements for the AquaH programme are quite stringent, please see our
              <a href="https://aquah.eu/apply/">
               Apply Page
              </a>
              for further information.
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
         <h2>
         </h2>
         <h2>
          Other questions
         </h2>

         </div>
         <p>

          </script>
         </p>
